title: As well as, whereas, while, as a consequence

content.text: Read the information below. Then, copy the information in your English notebook.
content.name: BAM4

content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-5xl mx-auto

content.text: There are different types of words in the English language which helps us join ideas. There might be idioms, connectors, or conjunctions.
content.name: 3Ovd

content.class: grid grid-cols-5 flex items-center gap-1 mt-5
text-center bg-yellow-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: As well as
content.name: dUgw
sTvn

content.class: text-center bg-lime-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Whereas
content.name: 6M6q
7tEL

content.class: text-center bg-pink-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: While
content.name: 1yV2
A03Y

content.class: text-center bg-violet-300 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: As a consequence
content.name: QGKw
RJXk

content.class: text-center bg-sky-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Meaning
content.name: 5IJ2
kcaD

content.class: text-center bg-yellow-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Idiom that means 'in addition' or 'and also'.
content.name: 9qfu
lAlP

content.class: text-center bg-lime-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Conjunction that means 'compared with the fact that; but'
content.name: QiXk
RUAu

content.class: text-center bg-pink-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Conjunction which is described as 'during the time that, or at the same time as'
content.name: a2jy
Qve9

content.class: text-center bg-violet-300 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Connector which means 'as a result'
content.name: k7Um
tePN

content.class: text-center bg-sky-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Example
content.name: JlgQ
NxxT

content.class: text-center bg-yellow-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: I like watching French movies as well as I get entertained by Italian films.
content.name: sEVo
7rHV

content.class: text-center bg-lime-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Britney enjoys dancing, whereas Justin rather sings.
content.name: 2v9q
lbO0

content.class: text-center bg-pink-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Peter was thinking about starting cooking lessons while her friend was creating one full course about that.
content.name: yu5H
elGL

content.class: text-center bg-violet-300 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: As a consequence of collecting trash from the beaches nearby, animals and plants from the area are healthier.
content.name: hKBP
dFIx

content.class: text-center bg-sky-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Explanation
content.name: GGuK
lycr

content.class: text-center bg-yellow-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: An ‘idiom’ is a group of words in a fixed order that has a particular meaning that is different from the meanings of each word on its own. It is used the same way for every  pronoun subject
content.name: s0bt
5teD

content.class: text-center bg-lime-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: 'Conjunctions' are words that join two elements within a sentence, such as clauses or nouns.  It is used the same way for every pronoun subject
content.name: uTi7
gNq3

content.class: text-center bg-pink-400 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: 'Conjunctions' are words that join two elements within a sentence, such as clauses or nouns.  It is used the same way for every pronoun subject.
content.name: 9lCj
Bhn4

content.class: text-center bg-violet-300 p-2 h-full flex items-center justify-center

content.text: Connectors are words that join two separate sentences. It is used the same way for every pronoun subject.
content.name: Nbvi
pGdn
JGOf

content.text: <font color=red>!</font> notice that Idioms, conjunctions and connectors help us joing ideas / express ideas.
content.name: JB6p

content.text: <font color=red>!</font> notice that as well as, whereas, while and as a consequence are used the same with all of the subject pronouns.
content.name: aSxx

content.text: <font color=red>!</font> notice that connectors and conjuctions are similar, but connectors join two sentences while conjunctions join two elements from a sentence.
content.name: WvS0

content.text: <font color=red>!</font> There are different idioms, connectors and conjunctions but we are focusing on these ones during this unit.
content.name: SVCt
4Cs6
